byline.contributor: Michael J. de la Merced contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: If antitrust officials reject the merger, AT&T owes Time Warner $500 million — a far smaller proportion of the deal’s value than is typical.

headline.print_headline: AT&T Isn’t Sweating Breakup Fee if the Merger Fails
headline.main: Why AT&T Isn’t Sweating the Breakup Fee in Its Time Warner Deal

snippet: If antitrust officials reject the merger, AT&T owes Time Warner $500 million — a far smaller proportion of the deal’s value than is typical....
abstract: AT&T chief exec Randall L Stephenson seems undisturbed about $500 million fee telecom giant may have to pay Time Warner if antitrust officials nix takeover; analysts say smaller-than-average breakup fee implies Time Warner is confident deal will be completed.
